definition: Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: They then discounted the results for volatility.
sentences.chinese: 接着他們又對波動性進行了折算。

sentences.english: Lochia rubra will recurred several times during puerperium, especially in CS group.
sentences.chinese: 產後惡露具有波動性，尤其是剖宮產組。

sentences.english: ResultsAll 7 patients showed prominent myokymia characterized by undulating and vermicular movements spreading across the muscle surface.
sentences.chinese: 結果7例均有典型的波動性和蟲蠕狀肌肉顫搐。

sentences.english: This “carry trade” created high returns with low volatility.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的“套息交易”創造了低波動性的高回報。

sentences.english: The fluctuation of agricultural land use change in Shangrao County.
sentences.chinese: 上饒縣農地利用變化的波動性。

sentences.english: Due to the fluctuation of demands, there are peak and off-peak in railway passenger transport.
sentences.chinese: 由於需求的波動性，鐵路客運存在高低峯運輸的差別。

sentences.english: 'The barbell gives you stability and volatility' at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 槓鈴式投資組合讓你同時擁有穩定性和波動性。

sentences.english: Growth and volatility are the characteristic features of growing economic cycle.
sentences.chinese: 增長性和波動性是增長型經濟週期的典型特徵。

sentences.english: The second point is that emerging markets are much less volatile than they have been in recent history.
sentences.chinese: 第二點是，新興市場的波動性較前些年大大減弱。

sentences.english: Vola- tilities of industrial stock price indices are often used to measure the industrial risks.
sentences.chinese: 行業股票價格指數的波動性常用來衡量行業的風險。
